chapter.title: Using Term Deposit module
chapter.para: This chapter describes the functions of Term Deposit module and explains how to request interest rates and perform deposit transactions using Opics Portal.

section.title: About Term Deposits
section.para: The Term Deposit module is a money market trading system that allows you to set up deals, add instructions for settlements, verify deals, generate confirmations, and run position inquiries and reports.

Using this module, you can process term deposits, fixed deposits, certificates of deposit, corporate deals, federal funds, and discount instruments. You can also handle pricing, position management, profit and loss calculation, exception based workflows, accounting, rate re-fixing, interim and principal payment scheduling, daily accruals calculations, rollovers, early maturities, and unscheduled payments.
Opics Portal facilitates initiating term deposit transactions, submitting them to the Issuing Bank, transaction reversal, and reverse/rebook.

section.title: Term Deposit Deals
section.para: Using Opics Portal, you can request for interest rate of a deposit deal by providing basic transaction details, such as currency, amount, value date, maturity date, etc. The portal forwards the request to Opics Plus, and based on the data associated with your account, the back-end application returns the all-in customer rate for the transaction. The displayed result stands valid for a specific time interval within which you can accept the rate offered by the bank to complete the transaction or reject it.

note.para: : During the time that the offered rate is active, if you make any modification to the deal, the existing rate is cancelled and you must place a fresh request for the deposit deal.

section.para: The subsequent section provides detailed explanation about deposit transactions such as, deal capturing, pricing, position management, and inquiries.

section.title: Creating a Term Deposit
section.para: In the portal Home page, click Term Deposit and under TD Initiation select From Scratch to create a new term deposit deal.
The input form and its respective fields are described in the following tables:

section.para: Specify the following under General Details section.

The request for rate is submitted to the bank where the back-end calculates and offers the applicable rate for the trade.

section.para: On receiving the rate offered by the bank, you can click the following buttons to decide the future of the deposit deal:

tip.para: : Opics Plus can accept a rate or a deal even after the rate has timed out or expired, if the rate proves to be beneficial for the bank.

section.title: Sending Message to Bank
section.para: Opics Portal facilitates sending messages to the bank to view and add standing instructions or to modify an existing deposit.

section.title: Viewing Standing Instructions
section.para: From the Main Menu, click Term Deposit and then under Message to Bank, click Standing Instructions. A list of records is displayed for all term deposits. Click the System ID of a deposit transaction to view the details of the deposit.
The following details are displayed under Customer Payment Instruction section.
Under Bank Payment Instructions, the instruction types are as follows:

listitem.para: Bank Instructions
Indicates the standing instructions assigned by the bank.
Free Format Instructions
Select this option to add standing instructions if it does not exist or to override instructions for the FX transaction from the portal.

note.para: : Manually entered instructions require authorization by a bank agent before the payments are generated.

section.title: Adding Standing Instructions
section.para: To add standing instruction using Opics Portal, under Bank Payment Instructions section, select Instructions type as Free Format Instructions and click Ok in the confirmation message-box.

You can specify Additional Details about the beneficiary, such as payment type (Wire or Draft), beneficiary name, address, account number, beneficiary bank details, etc., and click Submit to add payment instructions for the deposit transaction.

section.title: Modifying an Existing Deposit
section.para: Using Opics Portal, you can make the following modifications to an existing deposit transaction:

listitem.para: From the Main Menu, click Term Deposit and then under Message to Bank, click From Existing TD.
In the Ccy field, specify the currency of the deposit that needs to be modified and click Search. A list of records is displayed for all deposit transactions with the specified currency.
Click the System ID of a transaction to open the transaction for modification.
From the Action Details section, you can select the Rollover, Reverse, or Reverse/Rebook action.

section.title: To Rollover a Deposit
section.para: In Rollover Request section, specify the Rollover Maturity Date from the pop-up calendar. Besides, you can increase or decrease amount from the Original Amount, that is, the principal amount, and also find an option for Interest Capitalization.
Click Request to submit the rollover request to the bank. The request undergoes automatic or manual pricing and on completion, the rollover is accepted with the specified details.

note.para: : You can perform a rollover only if value date instructions are authorized by the bank.

section.title: To Reverse a Deposit
section.para: In Reverse Request section, specify the reason for reversal in Cancel Reason field and click Submit to reverse the term deposit.

section.title: To Reverse/Rebook a Deposit
section.para: In ReverseAnd Rebook Request section, specify the reason for reversal in Cancel Reason field. Specify the Amount, Value Date, and Maturity Date of the deal. Optionally, you can add Remarks for additional information about the deal.
Click Request to reverse the deal and re-submit it as a new deal.

section.title: Making a Term Deposit Inquiry
section.para: Opics Portal provides information about the status, the details, and the history of deposits initiated by the user. The list of transactions is confined to those transactions entered on the current processing date.
You can make inquiries on deposit transactions as follows:

listitem.para: From the Main Menu, click Term Deposit and then click TDInquiry.
In the Ccy field, specify the currency of the deposit.
Select the Output Format to display on Screen, or save the results in CSV or Spreadsheet.
Click Search to retrieve a list of records displaying deposit transactions in the specified currency.
Click the System ID of a transaction to view the details of a particular deposit.

tip.para: : You can use wildcards in your search string. For example, type *MYTEXT* to search for the items containing the MYTEXT string.

section.para: Moreover, you can also filter or sort the information returned from the portal on a multi or single column basis.
